title: Abberley Circular Walk Route

images.title: Philip Halling / St Michael's church, Abberley, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Michael's church, Abberley. St Michael's is the old church at Abberley and only the chancel still has a roof, the church was replaced in the nineteenth century when the new church was built. Services still take place in the chancel.

images.title: Philip Halling / Netherton House, Abberley, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Netherton House, below the eastern end of Abberley Hill.

images.title: Philip Halling / Farmland at Shavers End, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Farmland at Shavers End

images.title: Gordon Griffiths / Abberley Hill View, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Abberley Hill View. The view from the bench near the Trig. Point, with Abberley Hall Clock Tower in the distance.

images.title: Philip Halling / The Manor Arms at Abberley
images.caption: The Manor Arms at Abberley. The pub is a good choice for some refreshments after your walk

images.title: Philip Halling / Approaching the centre of Abberley
images.caption: View of the cottages in the village

description: This waymarked circular walk takes you through the countryside surrounding the pretty Worcestershire village of Abberley. The varied route runs for about 4 miles and includes woodland trails and a climb to Abberley Hill where you can enjoy splendid views of the surrounding countryside. The walk starts from the village green and then follows path through the village. You continue north east to Netherton House where you pick up the Worcestershire Way. This leads you south east to Shavers End where you climb through woodland toward Abberley Hill. Standing at a height of 283 metres (928 ft) the hills commands fine views over the Abberley and Malvern Hills Geopark. After taking in the views the route descends back down to the village where you can enjoy refreshments at one of the nice pubs or cafes. Part of this route uses a section of the Worcestershire Way long distance footpath. You can pick up the trail and follow it south past Abberley Hall to Woodbury Hill. Soon after you will come to the village of Martley where you can try the Martley Circular Walk .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Manor Arms in the village is a historic pub of some note. The inn has an interesting history dating back to the 17th century when it was owned by the Lord of the Manor and was originally a much smaller inn with its own brew house. They have a wonderful sunny terrace and decking area overlooking the hills behind the village. It's the ideal spot to relax in on warmer days. You can find the inn at a postcode of WR6 6BN for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The countryside, woodland and hills surrounding the village are ideal for a dog walk. The Manor Arms pub mentioned above also welcomes dogs with a dog friendly dining area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head just a few miles south of the village and you can visit the splendid Witley Court. Here you can explore the expansive gardens surrounding the palatial 19th century mansion.

display_address: The Hill, Abberley, Abberley, The Common Abberley, Malvern Hills, Worcestershire, England, WR6 6BP, United Kingdom
